snippet: Abid Hamid Hamoud, once No. 4 on the United States’ most-wanted list in Iraq, was the latest in a series of former senior Iraqi officials who have been executed.
abstract: Saddam Hussein’s trusted personal secretary Abid Hamid Hamoud, once No. 4 on the United States’ most-wanted list in Iraq, is executed by hanging; he is the latest in a series of former senior Iraqi officials who have been executed by Iraq’s new leaders.
lead_paragraph: Abid Hamid Hamoud, once No. 4 on the United States’ most-wanted list in Iraq, was the latest in a series of former senior Iraqi officials who have been executed.
